info.title: Devin API v3beta1
info.description: Devin API v3beta1 - Full RBAC support with service user authentication for enterprise and organization management.

get.description: List audit logs for the enterprise.

Get daily ACU consumption for the entire enterprise.

Returns total ACUs and consumption broken down by date.

**Timezone behavior**: Billing cycles use midnight PST (Pacific Standard Time)
as the day boundary, which corresponds to 08:00:00 UTC. To match the consumption
data shown in the Devin dashboard, pass Unix timestamps that align with this
timezone offset (e.g., 1733385600 for December 5, 2025 at midnight PST).

Get daily ACU consumption for a specific organization.

Returns total ACUs and consumption broken down by date for the org.

**Timezone behavior**: Billing cycles use midnight PST (Pacific Standard Time)
as the day boundary, which corresponds to 08:00:00 UTC. To match the consumption
data shown in the Devin dashboard, pass Unix timestamps that align with this
timezone offset (e.g., 1733385600 for December 5, 2025 at midnight PST).

Get daily ACU consumption for a specific session.

Returns total ACUs and consumption broken down by date for the session.

**Timezone behavior**: Billing cycles use midnight PST (Pacific Standard Time)
as the day boundary, which corresponds to 08:00:00 UTC. To match the consumption
data shown in the Devin dashboard, pass Unix timestamps that align with this
timezone offset (e.g., 1733385600 for December 5, 2025 at midnight PST).

Get daily ACU consumption for a specific user.

Returns total ACUs and consumption broken down by date for the user.

**Timezone behavior**: Billing cycles use midnight PST (Pacific Standard Time)
as the day boundary, which corresponds to 08:00:00 UTC. To match the consumption
data shown in the Devin dashboard, pass Unix timestamps that align with this
timezone offset (e.g., 1733385600 for December 5, 2025 at midnight PST).
List IDP groups registered with this enterprise.

post.description: Bulk create IDP groups for this enterprise. Existing groups are ignored.

delete.description: Remove a registered IDP group from this enterprise.

get.description: List service users in the enterprise.

patch.description: Update enterprise role for service user.

post.description: Assign enterprise role to service user.

get.description:
Get aggregated usage metrics for the enterprise account.

Returns counts of sessions, searches, and PRs (opened, closed, merged)
within the specified time range.

post.description: Create a new organization in this enterprise

delete.description: Delete an organization from this enterprise

patch.description: Update an organization's name and/or ACU limits

get.description: List audit logs for the organization.
List git permissions for the organization.
List service users in the organization.

post.description: Assign organization role to service user.

get.description:
Get aggregated usage metrics for the enterprise account.

Returns counts of sessions, searches, and PRs (opened, closed, merged)
within the specified time range.
Get the allowed session tags for an organization.

post.description: Append tags to the allowed session tags for an organization.

put.description: Replace the full set of allowed session tags for an organization.

delete.description: Remove a single tag from the allowed session tags for an organization.

post.description:
Programmatically provision a new service user at the enterprise level.

This endpoint allows service users with ManageAccountServiceUsers permission
to create new service users with a subset of their own permissions.

Security constraints:
- The target role's permissions must be a subset of the caller's permissions
- ManageAccountServiceUsers permission can never be granted
Create a note for an organization.
Create a playbook for an organization.
Create a secret for an organization.

delete.description: Delete a secret for an organization.

parameters.description: Whether to archive the devin session
parameters.name: archive

schema.description: Whether to archive the devin session

token.description: The API token for the service user. This is only shown once at creation time.

SessionSecretInput.description: Input model for a session secret provided via API.

BearerAuth.description: API Key authentication. Use Personal API Key (apk_user_*) or Service API Key (apk_*) for v1/v2. Use Service User credential (cog_*) for v3.
